intro: Tinus orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco tinus, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming during the dry season. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
